author.persName: Ni'mat Allah b. Habib Allah al-Harawi.

msItem.title: Makhzan i Afghani.
msItem.note: On rather coarse brownish paper. Inside front cover and flyleaf, verso: two notes in siyaq, not apparently connected with the book. Fourth flyleaf, verso: Mr? Marriott. The colophon states that the scribe is the owner of the book and gives his genealogy for eleven more generations. This manuscript was the basis of the translation published by B. Dorn (London 1829-36). So Storey. A history of the Afghans from the time of Adam to the reign of Jahangir. The shorter recension of the work. Some rubricated headings and punctuation.
msItem.incipit: Defective at beginning. ... aflak muwashshah gasht.

listBibl.bibl: Malcolm's gift is described in the Donations Register for 19 May 1827 and in the Transactions for 1830, pp. xcix-c. Several works on the Afghans are listed.

handNote.persName: Fath Khan son of Masnad Khan b. Kamal Khan Miyanah[?]

bindingDesc.p: Red leather Oriental binding with stamped cartouches and some painted decoration.

acquisition.p: Presented by Sir John Malcolm. So Morley's printed catalogue. (The handwritten one is silent on this).

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org
